headline: Will T-Mobile US' (TMUS) €1.5 Billion Euro Bond Deal Shift Its Capital Return Story?
summary: T-Mobile US recently completed two euro-denominated senior unsecured note offerings totaling about €1.50 billion, including 3.20% notes due 2032 and 3.625% notes due 2035, with an extensive syndicate of global banks underwriting the deals. The company plans to use the €2.50 billion raised across these and related euro notes for general corporate purposes, including potential share repurchases, dividends, and debt refinancing, which could influence how it balances growth investment with...
